Getting Started

An overview of SHML, how to download, install and use, syntax overview with examples.

To use SHML you must have unix-like (Darwin/OS X, Linux, etc.) POSIX-compliant operating system that supports ANSI/VT100 Control Sequences. If you are using an up to date version of OS X or any Linux distribution you should be good to go. If you run into issues please report it here.

Install

1-liner

$ curl -s https://raw.githubusercontent.com/maxcdn/shml/master/shml.sh -o /usr/local/bin/shml && chmod +x /usr/local/bin/shml

You can also just download SHML without installing it...

Git

$ git clone git@github.com:MaxCDN/shml.git

Wget

$ wget https://github.com/MaxCDN/shml/archive/master.zip

Sourcing

In order to use SHML you must tell your shell environment where it is located. Lets assume that we are writing a BASH script and want to use SHML.

If you installed in using the 1-liner above you would do:

#!/usr/bin/env bash
source $(which shml)

If you downloaded SHML using git or wget you would do:

#!/usr/bin/env bash
source ./shml.sh

Foreground

To set the foreground color of any string or object you need to call the color method followed by an argument.

Arguments

Colors

Fifteen different colors to choose from:

black red green yellow blue magenta cyan gray white darkgray lightgreen lightyellow lightblue lightmagenta lightcyan

Termination

Following a string or object you must terminate the color method to ensure color doesn't bleed. You can use any of the following termination arguments:

end off or reset

Code Samples

Here we will demonstrate how the foreground color method can be used on a single line.

echo $(color green "RZA GZA") $(color end)

Some times one-line is not enough.

echo "
$(color yellow)
Inspectah Deck
Ghostface Killah
$(color end)
"

You can also use c as an alias for color.

echo $(c red "Killa Beez on a swarm") $(c end)

Background

To set the background color of any string or object you need to call the background method followed by an argument.

Arguments

Colors

Fifteen different colors to choose from:

black red green yellow blue magenta cyan gray white darkgray lightgreen lightyellow lightblue lightmagenta lightcyan

Termination

Following a string or object you must terminate the background method to ensure color doesn't bleed. You can use any of the following termination arguments:

end off reset

Code Samples

Here we will demonstrate how the background method can be used on a single line.

echo $(background red "I'm the O-D-B") $(background end)

Some times one-line is not enough.

echo "
$(background grey)
...as you can see
$(background end)
"

You can also use bg as an alias for background

echo "$(bg green) C.R.E.A.M. $(bg end)"

Results

Here is what the output should look like. Style may differ slightly depending on your terminal emulator settings.

Attributes

The attribute method lets you stylize your text in 5 different ways.

Arguments

bold dim underline invert hidden

Termination

You can use any of the following termination arguments:

end off reset

Following a string or object you must terminate the attribute method. Typing $(attribute end) turns off everything, including foreground and background color methods.

Code Samples

$(attribute bold "Such Bold") $(attribute end)

$(attribute underline "So Underlined") $(attribute end)

$(attribute invert "Why this inverted?") $(attribute end)

You can also use a as an alias for attribute

$(a bold "Nice BOLD") $(a end)

Results

Here is what the output should look like. Style may differ slightly depending on your terminal emulator settings.

Elements

foo$(br)$(tab)bar
foo
    bar

foo$(br)$(indent)bar$(br)$(indent 6)boo
foo
bar
boo

> Note: short hand for indent is i

    $(hr)
    ------------------------------------------------------------

    $(hr 50)
    --------------------------------------------------

    $(hr '~' 40)
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

    $(hr '#' 30)
    ##############################

Icons

$(icon check) $(icon '<3') $(icon '*') $(icon ':)')

✓ ❤ ★ ☺

Argument List

check|checkmark, X|x|xmark, <3|heart, sun, *|star, darkstar, umbrella, flag, snow|snowflake, music, scissors, tm|trademark, copyright, apple, :-)|:)|smile|face

Emojis

$(color yellow 'My name is Dirt') $(emoji dog)

My name is Dirt 🐶

Argument List

panda, dog|woof, cookie, secure|lock, *|star, poop, monkey, cry|crying|=*(, =)|:-)|:)|smile|face

Color Bar

$(color-bar)

$(color-bar red green yellow blue magenta \
    cyan lightgray darkgray lightred \
    lightgreen lightyellow lightblue \
    lightmagenta lightcyan)


Short Hand: bar

$(bar red red red red)
